summary: The Small Business Administration's 8(a) program encourages the government to award contracts to businesses owned by members of socially and economically disadvantaged groups, such as Indian tribes. Under the 8(a) program, federal agencies can award contracts to such businesses either through competition or on a sole-source basis (without competition). We looked at contracts valued over $22 million that DOD awarded through the 8(a) program over...
title: DOD Small Business Contracting: Use of Sole-Source 8(a) Contracts over $22 Million Has Increased
